documentType: grand jury subpoena with non-disclosure order
summary: This document is a sealed grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Amazon.com, Inc., compelling the production of records associated with multiple email addresses and specific shipping/billing addresses linked to Jeffrey Epstein. It includes a non-disclosure order prohibiting Amazon from notifying the subscriber about the subpoena for 365 days, citing risks to the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signs the cover letter for the grand jury subpoena issued to Amazon.com, Inc., on behalf of the U.S. Department of Justice.

persons.name: Sarah Netburn
persons.context: Issues the sealed non-disclosure order accompanying the grand jury subpoena, authorizing the 365-day gag order on Amazon.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for Amazon
events.description: Amazon.com, Inc. is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce requested records by this date.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The grand jury subpoena to Amazon.com, Inc. is dated, demanding records related to specific email accounts and addresses.

events.title: Sealing and Non-Disclosure Order Issued
events.description: Magistrate Judge Sarah Netburn issues a sealed order prohibiting Amazon from disclosing the subpoena's existence for 365 days.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida 33480
49 Zorro Ranch Road, Stanley, New Mexico, 87056
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
300 Deschutes Way SW, Suite 304 Tumwater, WA 98501
keyFacts: The subpoena targets multiple email addresses believed to be associated with Jeffrey Epstein (e.g., jeeitunes@gmail.com, jeffityepsteinorg@gmail.com, jeevacation@gmail.com).

A sealed non-disclosure order under 18 U.S.C. § 2705(b) prohibits Amazon from notifying the account subscriber(s) about the subpoena for 365 days, citing risks like witness intimidation, evidence destruction, or flight from prosecution.
The subpoena seeks comprehensive records from Amazon, including subscriber info, IP addresses, order history, payment methods, and correspondence for the listed email accounts.
Specific addresses listed for records include Epstein's known residences: 358 El Brillo Way in Palm Beach, 9 East 71st Street in New York, and 49 Zorro Ranch Road in New Mexico.

The investigation involves suspected felonies under statutes including 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit trafficking), and 2422(b) (coercion/enticement).
